# News comment title:
US Law Enforcement Leaders Fear Trump Is Fueling Far-Right Terror

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
The only people fighting here are the Alt-Left.

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
The guy who drove his car into a demonstration agrees with you

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


You're either ignorant or lying. 

First, slavery was already well-established before the United States won the revolution and stopped being British. Some of the northern colonies/states had already abolished it by then, other northern states abolished it shortly thereafter. The southern states were deeply committed to keeping slavery; they wanted to expand it across the continent and down through Central America.

The Republican Party didn't even exist until the mid 1850's; it was founded almost entirely to oppose the expansion of slavery into new territories and states. It was ultra-liberal for the time. The Democrats (and what remained of other now-gone parties) were conservative. After the Civil War, Southern Democrats became even more conservative. Jim Crow was entirely on them. Republicans were still sporadically liberal; Ulysses S Grant, Teddy Roosevelt and Dwight Eisenhower were liberal Republicans. Hayes, Garfield, Taft, Coolidge and Hoover were more conservative. FDR was the first liberal Democrat. 

After the Civil Rights Act (1964), many of the liberals became Democrats, and many of the conservatives became Republican. Republicans became more conservative one issue at a time -- Nixon was lefty about the environment, unions, and health care but right-wing about foreign policy and drugs and judges. It wasn't until Reagan that Republicans became right-wing about everything, and people who were liberal about almost anything became Democrats.

>>> END COMMENT <<<
